question:
Consider the following reforms brought in India with viceroys associated to them:
  1. Factory Act 1881 - Lord Ripon
  2. Appointment of Hunter Commission to promote Education - Lord Dufferin 
  3. Arms Act 1879 - Lord Lytton
   Which of the above is/are correct?
explanation:
Hunter Commission was appointed by Lord Ripon in 1882 to promote education among Indians. Lord Ripon passed the factory act in 1881 to improve the dismal conditions of Indian factories. He introduced the concept of census in India. The first census of Indians was taken in 1881. One of the most significant reforms of Lord Ripon was introduction of local self government. 
Lord Lytton remained the Viceroy of India from 1876-1880. He introduced the Arms Act 1879.
